alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 8:47PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN ROOSEVELT...EAST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL...SOUTHEASTERN HARDING...CENTRAL QUAY AND WESTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM MDT... At 847 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Ute Lake State Park to 6 miles east of Tolar. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Portales, Quay, Tucumcari, Logan, Melrose, San Jon, Floyd, Grady, House and Saint Vrain. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 331 and 364. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 345 and 379. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 104 and 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Frequent dangerous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Curry County; Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County; Quay County; Roosevelt County
